body.p:
To his Excellency, Beriah Maggoffin
Governor of the commonwealth of Kentucky.

Your petitioner William Vinson States that at the last April term of the Lawrence circuit court, there was a fine of twenty Dollars ($20) adjudged against him for gaming, he States that the attorney for the Commonwealth Jas M, Nesbitt immediately, drew a letter to your excellency; and also Hon Jas M. Rice united in the same, asking the fine to be remitted which letter in may last was forwarded to your Excellency, your petitioner asks, that you will interpose in his behalf, he states that the gaming for which he was fined; took place one night in the county jail while they was guarding they was guarding the same, (the other two in the game was Jesse Meek^s^ and Claiburn Hyton) he states that they had no intention while in the game to gamble for gain and only inte^n^ded it for pastime, he says the fine is oppressive, and he asks your clemency & will ever &c,
We whose names are hereto assigned most respectfully ask that the fine be remitted

Lawrence Cir Ct
Remitted
B. M
$20 each } Gaming
Jesse Meek & others
Issd Jany 22d 1861
